DOC.detailed_description: Background : Veterans present treatment substance use disorder ( SUDs ) often multiple serious comorbid medical condition affect functional health status health care cost . Prior study show high rate medical follow-up onsite primary health care provide patient SUDs within addiction clinic ( onsite care ) . However , data available difference onsite versus referral model primary care delivery term clinical outcome total health care cost . Objectives : The objective study compare patient SUDs receive onsite primary care VA outpatient addiction clinic refer primary care general internal medicine clinic : 1 ) medical outcome quality life ; 2 ) SUD treatment outcome ; 3 ) overall health care cost . This information assist identifying practice guideline provide preventive service treatment acute chronic medical condition individual SUD treatment . Methods : This study randomize clinical trial two treatment condition : 1 ) onsite primary care Addictions Treatment Center ( ATC ; experimental ) ; 2 ) referral primary care General Internal Medicine Clinic ( GIMC ; control ) . Subjects assess baseline 3 , 6 , 12-month time point . The sample include 720 veteran , newly present return SUD treatment , exhibit chronic medical condition screening , primary care provider ; present serious medical condition require ongoing care three organ system . Medical status outcome measure include score SF-36 , total emergency room visit medical surgical inpatient admission . Substance abuse outcome measure treatment retention , change Addiction Severity Index ( ASI ) score , self-reported alcohol use . Lastly , overall VA health care cost per subject per 12-month period follow randomization compare across group . The main analysis involve intent-to-treat analysis group ( onsite vs. referral ) time ( 3 , 6 , 12-month ) use random effect regression model . Status : Complete . All subject complete study intervention 3/31/2004 . Currently data analysis ongoing .
